shelve.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to decide not to continue with a plan, idea etc, although you might continue with it at a later time
shelve.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Plans to reopen the school have been shelved.
shelve.translation[0].definitions[1].def: land that shelves is at a slight angle
shelve.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The garden shelves gently towards the sea.
shelve.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to put something on a shelf, especially books
shelve.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to decide not to continue with a plan, idea etc, although you might continue with it at a later time
shelve.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Plans for the project have been shelved.
The company agreed to shelve its 300 billion warrant-bond issue.
